text: <@U38EZFVFE> is there some documentation on this? Or a link? Thank you
If you wanna go quick and dirty… create your form and via javascript sync the fields into a hidden HubSpot form in the background… :smile:

Hello!

I'm trying to create a popup for a webpage that is triggered only when someone clicks on a particular cta. I googled enough about it but couldn't really find a solid solution. Is this even possible in HubSpot ? If yes, can someone tell me what exactly I need to do ?
<@UGMGP7A72> I was actually thinking of the search client. BUT ajax form submit isnt that hard.

Hey sandipan, you can def do this in HubSpot, I have created pop-up modules for video players and images in the past.
Basically you'll have to create a hidden `<div>` that contains your pop-up content, and use javascript to show it on a click event.

There are also other modules available on the HubSpot marketplace that could accomplish this as well

here is a forum thread that I found discussing it
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/Popup-HubSpot-form-on-CTA-click/td-p/196910>
Does Hubl offer a way to read query string params in modules or do we need to use Javascript to do so?  For example, if I pass ?model=123 in the url.
Yes you can read query params via HubL using `{{request.query_dict}}` <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-variables>
If testing for a specific parameter i. The url you can do it like `{% if request.query_dict.model == "123" %}`
